definitions.definition: (of a state) oppressive, tedious, and seemingly without end.
(of a sound or motion) harsh and grating.
reduce (something) to small particles or powder by crushing it.
examples: grind some black pepper over the salad
synonyms: comminute "the sandstone is ground into powder"

definitions.definition: (of a mill or machine) work with a crushing action.
examples: the old mill was grinding again

definitions.definition: sharpen, smooth, or produce (something) by crushing or by friction.
examples: power from a waterwheel was used to grind cutlery
synonyms: sandpaper "a knife being ground on a wheel"

definitions.definition: operate (a mill or machine) by turning the handle.
examples: she was grinding a coffee mill

definitions.definition: rub or cause to rub together gratingly.
examples: tectonic plates that inexorably grind against each other
synonyms: rasp "one tectonic plate grinds against another"

definitions.definition: move noisily and laboriously, especially against a countering force.
examples: the truck was grinding slowly up the hill
go-go girls grinding to blaring disco
